Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: carlingirl1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sommerset Hotel in San Diego mid-August and had a fabulous time! Made all my arrangements thru Jen, who was wonderful! She made sure our rooms (5 of them for 17 of us) were close together with balconies. The hotel itself is very clean with bedrooms attached to living areas. One night we were so tired we just brought pizza into the room and were able to accomodate all of us (from 4 months up to grandparents) in the living space. There is a full kitchen which came in handy for meals and snacks and the beds were really comfortable. Outside is a hot tub and pool and a Friday night bbq that the hotel provides and there is a continental breakfast every morning that the kids just loved. We went to: a Chargers football game, Seaport Village, USS Midway, Old Town and Little Italy and all the locations were within 30 minutes of the hotel. On Sunday morning I took the kids out to walk the Hillcrest area which is full of neighborhood restaurants, bars, pizza places, etc. and found "Babycakes" cupcakes within walking distance which has the best cupcakes in the world! We ate 3 dozen in 2 days! Would highly recommend this hotel and especially Jen and the staff for a great family trip!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms and Unbelievable Service”
Reviews.Author: muellerjja
Reviews.Content: The bedroom suites where huge for me and my family. For a reasonable price and great location, you can't beat the prices of other hotels. We had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen. The housekeeping would come in and do your dishes for you including the normal cleaning. They had a great breakfast bar in the mornings with guest services assisting you with your food selections so you could relax. I recommend everyone who wants 5 star service for 3 star prices to check out sommerset.

Reviews.Title: “We've been coming to Sommerset Suites for 20 years and it's better than ever.”
Reviews.Author: cqibaxter
Reviews.Content: We started coming to Sommerset Suites before our son was born. We did a lot of daytime activity and lots of nightlife. The location of the Sommerset was perfect for all our needs. We enjoyed having the kitchen facilities and found having the king bed suite was very comfortable for hanging out in the living room, and the separate bedroom made it very quiet for sleeping. The patio area with the shallow pool and the jacuzzi is great for kids and adults alike. Our son, who's now 13, has grown up vacationing in San Diego and thinks of the Sommerset as another home. The staff, always friendly and warm, have added a lot to the "homey" feeling, in addition to being completely accomodating and helpful. Breakfast is served daily and now there is a summertime Friday night barbeque, which I'm told, may continue into the fall and winter. The rates are extremely reasonable and we wouldn't stay anywhere else. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JSlaughter
Reviews.Content: Full kitchens (with dishes, a small assortment of pots/pans and utensils), comfortable rooms, luxurious bedding, outstanding customer service, well appointed bathrooms. We love the freebies (cookies and fruit-laced water in the lobby, granola bars, microwave popcorn, and bottled waters in the rooms). Good location, even with the hospital across the street. All our needs have been attended to every time we've stayed, and it's become our go-to hotel when we travel to San Diego. I can't speak highly enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Well Run”
Reviews.Author: George A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our teenage son for 3 weeks during June / July 2010. It was our 7th visit to the city, but first staying in the Hillcrest area, which was great! Everywhere locally is walkable, lots of varied types of retaurants, cinema, shops - and as we did not have a car - a good bus service too. Hotel. Very clean and well located. Our room was spacious, comfortable but a little dated. Having a kitchen area was a real bonus, as we did not always want to eat out. Our room was at the rear which overlooks a local hospital with construction in progress. Work seems to begin at around 6am, so a bit of noise from thereon. Also some ambualce siren noise from time to time, but we got used to it. Free WiFi in room. Breakfast. Hosted by a very jolly lady, who was always more than happy to help. All served on disposable plates/dishes/cups, but included in the rate. Good variety of choice and plenty available. Friday evenings there was a managers barbeque. Again plenty of food, beer and wine. A very welcoming touch and an opportunity for the guest to meet. Staff. Very helpful and friendly!! Overview. Great location, great staff, would definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: tommym2u
Reviews.Content: Checked in only to find out that the two dbl bed room I reserved/paid for was "under maintenance" I was given a room with one bed. All the prior visits I stayed in a one bedroom suite just like the one pictured on the website.. not this time; a very small room which looked like something from the 1970's, very old and out dated and small. I was told that all or my prior visits I must have had "the luck of the draw getting one of the rooms pictured on the website. I feel cheated and that Sommerset was/is very deceitful. If you MUST stay in Hillcrest, OK, if not... RUN to the numerous hotels in San Diego that offier much better room at better prices.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Excellent Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jility
Reviews.Content: After spending WAY too much time online searching for the right place to stay, I booked the Sommerset. The reason was the value compared to the others in the area. Parking costs $6.00 per night but the others close by were $22. A night! The Hillcrest District is awesome!!! Great food and everything you could ever want. There is a movie theater around the corner and it is within walking distance to the hospitals and doctors. The staff were friendly and helpful and I LOVED the fruited water in the lobby! The parking is very tight but there is an overflow lot for oversized vehicles. Unfortunately, my GPS kept trying to take me to the OTHER 606 Washington a mile in the other direction so I had some trouble finding it without the hotel’s help. They could use larger TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: orlandruiz
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service. The manager and staff went way beyond their duties to get me the room I wanted and the stuff I needed in my room. It is rare to find service like that anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Understand The Good Reviews: Overpriced Noisy Motel!”
Reviews.Author: 1worldtraveler3
Reviews.Content: There Are Many Hotel Options In The San Diego Area...I Don't Understand The Praise Given To This Overpriced Basic Motel-Like Motor Inn...Very Tight Parking For Additional Fees Charged For Your Car Per Each Night...Very Thin Walls With Loud Noise From Streets & Noisy Hallways/Courtyard...Very Small Pool With Many Screaming Kids...Not The Most Friendly Or Helpful Front Desk Staff... Even With A "Discounted" Rate We Feal It Is Very Overpriced For What It Is...We Will Definitely Try Another Hotel In San Diego On Our Next Trip!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay I have ever had at a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wulfaz70
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is some of the best I have ever encountered, They are truely here to help out in what ever they can do for the guest's. In my opinion the are some of the most professional staff around. I would gladly stay here the next time I come to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: Vicki1968
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 13 year-old daughter visited San Diego for the first time and were pleasantly pleased with the Sommerset Suites on Washington St. We arrived in town around late morning/ early afternoon and after having lunch, I called the hotel to check on early check-in. They had a room ready for us in 1/2 an hour. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and spacious. The beds extremely comfortable. This hotel is very conveniently located to all the major attractions in San Diego. The breakfast was delicious and well maintained. The pool/spa area was beautifully landscaped. Everything was just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and the great weather in February was a bonus”
Reviews.Author: Blaze8762
Reviews.Content: The Hillcrest section of San Diego is a wonderful neighborhood. We have stayed here twice and enjoy the many small restaurants which you can easily walk to for breakfast or dinner. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Kira108
Reviews.Content: Our family traveled to San Diego for our summer vacation. After calling several hotels, Sommerset was able to accommodate a family of 5 most comfortably and economically. We have 2 teenagers and 1 child. The newly remodeled hotel had very comfortable beds and was clean. The Sommerset was close to the zoo, Sea World, Old Town San Diego, beaches, the Naval base, Legoland, and the Gas Lamp district (Hard Rock Cafe). Being close to all these attractions allowed us to come back to the hotel and clean up before going out for dinner. We were also able to get back in plenty of time to take advantage of the heated swimming pool and whirlpool. Breakfast included cereal, oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, and waffles. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The only comment that could possibly be negative (depending on how you look at it) is that the hotel is located next to two hospitals. Sirens went off frequently throughout the day and night. This would not stop us from staying here again or recommending this hotel to others. Also when booking be aware that you'll be charged $6 a day for parking. Again, this is not a negative, just something to know when booking with Sommerset. Our family would definitely stay at Sommerset again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home ...”
Reviews.Author: raf_in_philly
Reviews.Content: ... with served breakfast and housekeeping on a daily basis! One cannot ask for more from a hotel! You will meet the friendliest and most helpful staff to make you feel comportable. The suites are like complete apartments - inlcuding a full kitchen, not like other places! And the location is unbeatable, Hillcrest, one of the nicest neighborhoods in San Diego, one of the most popular destinations. Great for extended stays! Finally, the rates offered cannot be seen elsewhere. Excellent hotel, excellent value. Stay at the Sommerset Suites hotel!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised, nothing fancy but a great price”
Reviews.Author: irishwanderlust
Reviews.Content: From the outside it looks old, but it is clean and comfortable (but a bit worn) and has plenty of room for our group of 4. Suites have full kitchens with fridge, an oven and microwave. Restaurants right around the corner. Whole foods and Trader Joe's nearby as well as Vons grocery. Friendly staff, Martha at breakfast is very sweet and even makes your waffle if you need her to. Basic breakfast with bagels, muffins, cereals, yogurt, fruit, hard boiled eggs and juices and coffee. Yes there is a hospital right across the street, so some siren noise but none in the middle of the night. Overall good area not in a tourist trap location, but close to zoo and balboa park. Great place to give everyone some elbow room for 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families.”
Reviews.Author: lalagirl22
Reviews.Content: My husband, toddler son, and I have stayed at the Sommerset Suites twice in the last month as we prepare to relocate to San Diego. I did a fair amount of research before we traveled, and felt the SS would offer the most in terms of amenities for the price. Our main need was a kitchen since we were bringing homemade baby food with us, and were on a budget. The property is a bit dated, so don't expect luxury in terms of room, bathroom or kitchen amenities. However, we found everything to be clean and met our needs. The staff were great - we needed a few things for our son (extra sheets after he got sick one night, extra trash cans for diapers, etc.) and every request was met within minutes. This past trip, all of the self-serve luggage carts were gone from downstairs - my husband informed the front desk and a cart was quickly to our door. Overall, we felt it was a good choice. Here is a quick list of the good things: -friendly and helpful staff - everyone we came into contact with was great -reasonably priced parking ($6 night) -free wireless internet -full kitchens with refrigerators, range top, oven, dishwasher and microwave -huge pantry area with sliding door off kitchen to store all the extras that come with young children - food, toys, etc. -his/her closets in bedroom -ironing board and safe in room -free breakfast in the morning with MYO waffles, hard-boiled eggs, juices, coffee, bagels, muffins and fruit -centrally located on Washington in Hillcrest - just off the 163, minutes to the 5 - and right in the midst of all the restaurants and shops in Hillcrest -pretty quiet given its urban location (it is near a hospital...during our second trip we did hear the ambulance a few times) -plenty of room for all the toys you can stuff in the car -pool for older children -computer/inernet terminal with printer by the front desk And the not-so-good: -older property -you can hear noise from the pool most of the day since most of the rooms have windows that face the pool courtyard -some noise given the location -no free parking -no hair dryer in room -not a luxury property

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ColtsNeck_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Sommerset Suites. The staff is great . They are friendly and also did everything to accommodate my request to have a room in a specific area of the hotel. The value is good. You pay for parking but the cost is minimal compared to other hotels. Free wireless is a plus. The suite size is fine for up to 4 people. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast which is sufficient to get you through the morning. As previous guests have stated, there are usually lots of young kids. But, this should be expected if you are staying in a hotel that has all suites. This is a great value if you are staying long term and want to cut down on some of the costs of eating out. Although there are tons of places to eat and visit within walking distance I recommend a car if you want to venture out of the Hillcrest and Balboa park area. There is no on-site fitness center but there is a small pool and spa plus a local gym. If you want a nice hotel at a great price with a great staff, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Service, Location, and comfort -- small hotel with bed-and-breakfast feel”
Reviews.Author: CapriLeesburg
Reviews.Content: The Sommerset Suites is ideally located in the Hillcrest neighborhood of Mission Hills. It sits near the accesses to 5 and 163 as well as local bus service stops. It's just minutes' walk to great neighborhood restaurants, cafes, fitness facility, shops, movie theatre, grocery stores and residential areas. Balboa Park and San Diego Zoo are a little over a mile away (both walkable from Sommerset Suites). Downtown San Diego and the Gaslamp Quarter are about a 30 minute walk; as is Little Italy and Old Town, depending on your pace. Favorite nearby events are the farmers market in Little Italy on Saturdays and the Hillcrest Farmers Market on Sundays The hotel itself is simple and clean. The rooms/suites are comfortable and very adequate. Our two stays, each for a month in February/March in 2009 and 2010 were very pleasant. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite which includes a large bedroom with TV, queen-sized sofa bed , equippped kitchen, dining room table and chairs, living room area with TV and balcony . On each occasion family members stayed a few days with us and were very comfortably accommodated within our suite. The hotel offers a complete breakfast consisting of a great variety of items: hard-boiled eggs, real waffles, bagels, toast, cereals, yogurts, fruit, pastries, juices, coffee/tea. The breakfast area is sunny and cheerful, just adjacent to the outdoor patio and pool. The pool/patio area includes gas grills for grilling food that can be purchased at nearby Whole Foods, Trader Joe's and 3 other grocery stores. There's a fitness center and garage parking. The staff is extremely courteous and accommodating. They are sensitive to guests' needs and impart a family feeling. This is an older but well-maintained property. My husband and I have stayed here two years in a row for over a month during each stay. We recommend Sommerset Suites to everyone we talk to. It is an excellent value and simply a welcoming, intimate and comfortable place to be when you're not out and about enjoying San Diego and environs. We've seen many families with kids here too. While we were here we met other couples who also come for long-term (one month plus) stays. We sit with each other at breakfast and catch up on the previous days' activities and chat about the plans for the day, comparing notes on where to go, where the bargains are, and what's going on -- opera, concerts, newborns at the zoo. We've even met up in the evening for dinner in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “great place for snowbirds who don't like florida”
Reviews.Author: anitastrauss
Reviews.Content: we have been coming every winter since 1994. love the location for us. Near to movies, peo, grocery shopping, balboa park, zoo, public transportation. The staff is wonderful, friendly and helpful. we used to enjoy meeeting people at a social hour and now the only time we get to meet peiople is at breakfast. wish there was a small social hour again. the other thing that would make our stay better is to have a dvd in our room.

Reviews.Title: “I have traveled many places, Sommerset was outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: SiandraTexas
Reviews.Content: I needed to be in San Diego, CA for approximately 7 weeks. Staying at the Sommerset Suites was like being home. Everyone was accommodating, the service was excellent, the rooms were extremely comfortable. I have fibromyalgia and a bad back, so sleeping on a comfortable bed is extremely important for me. The bed and bedding were like sleeping at home! The hotel was extremely clean and the staff was always working hard to keep everything clean, including the grounds. The purpose of my trip was to be with my college student, who had major surgery over the Christmas holidays and I needed to travel back to California to be with her. She stayed with me at the hotel until she felt comfortable enough to stay on campus. I also brought my little seven pound poodle with me. Both of them felt like they were at home. The entire staff, from management down to housekeeping were outstanding and made you feel like family. One of the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at that made me feel like family!!!!! The location was great, close to groceries, restaurants, shopping malls, etc. I will definitely stay there whenever we go gack!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: mrsbrak
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read the previous bad review. We had Room 34 overlooking the pool and it was great. Not luxury-resort-hotel great, but well worth the price. Our suite was very spacious -- like a small apartment -- with a separate bedroom w/TV, efficiency kitchen, and sitting area w/TV and sofa. My mom stayed in a non-suite room down the hall, but it was spacious too. Everything in both rooms was very clean and in good working order. Very comfortable beds. The bathrooms were nicely updated and spotless. The kitchenette even had a filtered water dispenser on the sink -- a welcome amenity since San Diego tap water isn't the best. They even had guest bathrobes in the closets. Didn't use them, but we thought it was cute. Free wifi worked fine. Some hotels charge extra for this, so this was a plus. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was your average bagel and boiled egg offering. But there are plenty of good restaurants and shops within walking distance. My only 2 criticisms are the ambulance noise from the hospital nearby (but it didn't keep me awake) and the tiny parking spaces (additional $6 daily), but we didn't have too much trouble parking the SUV we rented.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed family suite close to Zoo and Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: journeydesigner
Reviews.Content: I chose this location because we were looking for a room that could accommodate our family of 4 and was located close to the zoo and Seaworld. The room we booked was very large and clean and included a full size kitchen, dining table, sofa bed and a separate bedroom with 2 queen beds. The complimentary breakfast was good and we were provided with fresh waffles, but be prepared to tip the breakfast staff. The location of this accommodation is ok if you have a car, however there is a $6 daily parking fee. The room was generally quiet although due to the close location to Mercy hospital there were occasional siren noises. The hotel also has good laundry facilities, which are require when travelling with kids. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a value for money suite in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great place for families”
Reviews.Author: MegBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week, got a great rate thru the hotel website. Stayed in a double suite, had lots of space, good kitchen, sitting area, seperate bedroom, newly renovated, big bathroom, on the 4th floor, very quiet. Breakfast was great, waffles, bagels, coffee, juice, yogurt, fruit- all included in rate. Had nice laudry facilities. Small pool but good size for little kids (cold, but this was December!) Staff was lovely, parking directly under hotel for only $6 per day, we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Disabled Guests”
Reviews.Author: g1llday
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at this great hotel and we were thrilled with everything. In California the toiliets are very low and we asked if the hotel had anything which could help as I am disabled.Within minutes a toilet chair was delivered. Excellent! We were initially given a room with a poor view asked to change and it was not a problem. The staff were all lovely and very helpful.We enjoyed ouf stay here so much we extended it twice! The breakfasts were excellent and waffles to die for. Excellent food near by all recommended by the hotel. The bed in our room was fabulous really comfy and take no notice of the moaners who mention noise. We had no problem. Well done Sommerset Suites, We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; good location and the most friendly service you could ask for.”
Reviews.Author: sal06NI
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about the noise at the hotel from surrounding hospitals after reading reviews and wanted to put others minds at rest if you are thinking of booking this hotel. We stayed at the hotel in November and had a great time. The service was fantastic, from the moment we arrived with a very quick check in, to the service at breakfast and a smooth check out at the end. The staff were lovely and would do anything to help. The rooms were nothing special but had everything you would need, especially in the kitchen, and were clean. Located in Hillcrest area, not too far from all the tourist areas of San Diego and very good public transport. Close enough to walk through Balboa Park to downtown if you were feeling active! Pool area looked great, really well designed, and even a heated spa pool so good for winter too (Nov temps around late 60's to early 70's anyway). Breakfast extensive, waffles, cereals, fruit, yoghurts, bagels, toast, eggs etc. Quiet enough rooms, not too much noise in the bedroom from the road or hospitals, some noise in the living area but not bad. Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: nyrookie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. I've always been a little suspect of the cleanliness of hotels with kitchens in the rooms, but Sommerset was pristine in every way. The accommodations were more than I expected at this type/class of hotel. It almost felt luxury when we entered the suite. It was definitely not luxury upon closer inspection, but their effort to make things nice was apparent, well executed, and greatly appreciated. First off, the suite was huge and laid out in a way that made it feel more like an apartment. The bed was big and plush and extremely comfortable, the closet was HUGE, the sofa was just right for snuggling in front of the tv, and the kitchen had all the cooking stuff we needed. The little patios were a cute idea, but ours loooked out over the parking lot of the building next door and wasn't as private as it could have been with better design. The free breakfast every morning was a nice touch, and the lady manning the breakfast room (who makes extra thick, yummy waffles) was very nice. Parking there is kind of tight, but doable with some skill, good timing, and a compact car. Getting to the lobby from the parking lot was also a little weird. There are restaurants and a grocery store within walking distance, but you need a car to get to the touristy stuff. Overall, this hotel was a great find and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Shar309
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for a family wedding and stayed for sightseeing. We were able to walk to restaurants, grocery stores and even to the zoo. The rooms are pleasant: the beds are comfy and the kitchen is a big plus as it allows you eat "'at home" so you didn't have to go out for every meal as well as allowed us to reheat our left overs. The staff ran the dishwasher in the morning when they came in to clean. The facility is not new, but it has been updated and the helpfulness of the staff makes up the difference. I didn't miss an exercise room since we did so much walking around town. The parking was tight but also cost less than at other hotels. We were aware of the sirens but they didn't really bother us. We stayed for 3 nights and then moved to an outlying area for an additional 3 nights. The other hotel cost less, but we were much happier at the Sommerset.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: If you need a hotel in the Hillcrest area, this is pretty much the ONLY hotel there is! Here's the good reasons to stay here: 1. GREAT location. There is soooooooo much to can walk to - restaurants, bars, clubs, grocery stores, stores. It's in a great spot! Although downtown is about 3 miles, on a nice day (which most are in San Diego) it would be a really easy walk! There is plenty of public transportation (bus) as well. 2. Physical property. It's a cool set up - in a U shape with a nice pool/spa/patio area in the middle. It makes it easy to enjoy the great SD weather. 3. Room size. The rooms are all suites with a full kitchen and a sep. bedrroom. Very spacious! It appears all rooms have a patio with furniture - which is awesome! 4. Very clean! 5. Free Wifi that worked very well! The negatives: 1. Although I loved the location and physical layout, the hotel is a bit outdated. Certain things are fairly up-to-date (like the bedding) but other things (like the kitchen) could use a little modernism. In any case, it's all comfortable and worked for us.. 2. The bathroom shower was probably the worst hotel shower head I've had in a while. Maybe it was just bad luck in this room?! It was a cheap fiberglass tub and a THIN shower curtain and didn't hold the water back. 3. At check-in, the clerk was a little surly. However, the other staff I ineracted with seemed a bit friendlier. 4. They charge $6/day for parking, which I thought was a bit ridiculous. 5 There is no workout room! I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I would be great if they updated the furnishings...but then again the rates would probably go up?!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Clean, spacious, affordable.”
Reviews.Author: rick_in_phx
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights there during a 4-day jaunt to SD with a great price of $119/night. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful on the phone before we left home and on our arrival. Our room was clean and stocked with sufficient cookware and dishes. The bed was comfy with nice bedding and lots of pillows. The patio was nice (view of misc. nearby bldgs.), with chairs. The living room had a hide-a-bed sofa, which could have accommodated 2 more people. Parking was relatively cheap at $6/day (compare to other places - you'll see – this beats $15/day or catch-as-catch-can-and-hope on the street) in a parking garage, right out of the elevators' basement level. This place is basically your own apartment in San Diego - with satellite TV in bedroom and living room, and free inter-net. Furniture was high quality, nice counter tops etc. The building isn't new but is upgraded and roomy and has a pool and spa in the patio area along with several large BBQ grills for guests' use. Breakfast was wonderful, a cheerful staff member was on hand to help with the waffle irons to make your perfect large waffle (or several small ones) along with juices, coffee, milk, cereals, hot hard-boiled eggs, bagels, fruit, etc. Excellent breakfast and a money saver. We occasionally did hear a siren, but it wasn't a problem. We enjoyed our stay and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Deal at The Sommerset”
Reviews.Author: mikeb52s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just 2 nights of a 5 day visit in SanDiego. This was recommended by a friend who lives in the Hillcrest section of SD. If you dont require an ocean or harbour view for your visit, this property is a great value for your stay. Any or All major attractions are a mere 5-10 minute drive from here. Parking is only $6.00 a day....FREE and simple WIFI internet...Clean and spacious accomadations, with completely equipped kitchenettes if you need that. They even supply you with a very good coffee maker, great coffee too.... in a welcome basket with micro popcorn, bottled water, and granola bars! A real nice touch on top of the already stocked bathroom amenities with soaps and shampoos. Theres a Hot tub Jacuzzi, and the hotel pool is just enough to start your day, or relax and unwind after a day out. Also just walking distance the the many shops, cafes and clubs that Hillcrest has to offer. This find is my new place to stay anytime I visit SD. Thanks to Bridget and Lovelynn for their professionalism, and having the answers for any questions I may have asked. I will be returning again!

Reviews.Title: “They Aim to Please!!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestKC
Reviews.Content: Except for the tight parking, everything about the Sommerset Suites Hotel is Wonderful!! This is the 4th time I've stayed here. For the price, location, amenities, breakfast and professionalism of ALL staff, THIS IS THE PLACE!! Next time, in March'10, I will definitely bring my bathing suit!! Watch for online and senior specials, too!

Reviews.Title: “Medium size hotel that treats its guest -like guests.”
Reviews.Author: Tchase2
Reviews.Content: This well situated, medium size, well maintained motel could have simply accepted my payment and I would have been OK with my purchase. Sommerset went far past that. Friendly check in staff, an in-room welcome basket with snacks, kitchenettes, terry robes, free wifi (with desktop & printer in the lobby); & a complimentary breakfast with hot waffles. WOW! Medium size unassuming motel really wants my business. The nice size breakfast area is adjacent to the pool & hot tub. Birds of Paradise and other flowering shrubs abound. Very plesant place to relax. The Hillcrest neighborhood has a huge selection of restaurants and entertainment venues. Parking is very moderately priced.

Reviews.Title: “Run down, but still nice”
Reviews.Author: Rejsende5487478
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really spacious with balconys, and that is nice. The pool area is ok, but in the shade during the afternoon. The whole place is pretty worn, and it is not stylish or charming at all. Location is great, if you want to go out in HillCrest. Breakfeast is ok, and the lady working there is really nice. Clean all over, and staff is friendly. Parking 6$.

Reviews.Title: “Sommerset Suites Hotel is the Best Choice in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Jim018
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for several years. It is at the top of the list for San Diego Hotels. It is withing walking distance to one of the most appealing neighborhoods in San Diego, Hillcrest. Restaurants, clubs, bars are just blocks away. The hotel offers excellent accomodations. A big plus is that each room has a small kitchen. Perhaps the greatest asset of the hotel is the staff who make each guest feel welcome and like family. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Way Beyond Our Wildest Expectations”
Reviews.Author: dslinsd
Reviews.Content: We are staying in a one-bedroom suite in the Hillcrest area of San Diego for weeks until we can move into our condo. All of the staff here are friendly, courteous and very professional. They all have been extremely helpful. The hotel has a swimming pool and laundry facilities. Our room has two tv's. A full-service kitchen. It is like a one bedroom apartment. We are near many, many very good restaurants and there is a movie theater nearby. You can walk to the bank, cleaners, shops, and restaurants--just blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Everything *I* need”
Reviews.Author: chat121
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at this terrific. spotless motel with especially lovely plants/flowers by the pool and hot tub where I could watch hummingbirds feed. The first time was for 2+ weeks last December and this year for the same. I had a large, comfortable 1 bedroom unit that included a sofa bed in the main room and tvs in both the living room and bedroom. Since I am a diabetic and have some food issues, I prefer to cook most of my own food. However, there are dozens of restaurants within minimal walking distance and food shops like Whole Foods, Trader Joes, Ralphs, Vons, etc.etc.The room itself while a little dated decor-wise was spotlessly clean and had everything I needed including a full-sized 'fridge, microwave, oven and cooktop, toaster and all necessary pans and utensils. Anything I lacked, the friendly, accommodating Mexican staff brought in, including immediate fixing of wayward plumbing (a toilet that ran). Aron the manager was extremely friendly, helpful and solved an internet problem while I was there. It's true that the building is situated across from a hospital because it was former accommodation for student nurses and doctors, but any complaints about that like in a former review should be modified. If you need a quiet place, you don't park yourself next to a hospital no matter how much double glazing there is. I also booked this motel because of the heated swimming pool and jacuzzi which I needed to workout torn shoulders. The only thing that can be improved in this regard is that there should be a sign--and it made clear when registering--that after hours--or dinner at least--that the small jacuzzi area should be child free and a place to relax since it is very small. Even though I booked the corner room I'd had previiously, at one time a family moved in above me with apparently two small children running and stamping around. But all it took from me was a polite visit upstairs to let the mother know and the problem was solved. My unit had a nice balcony with a view of a freeway, but at least it was a place to sit out and enjoy fresh air. It's true that the breakfast could be improved because there is not much for a diabetic. However, that is certainly a special need and I don't expect every hotel/motel to accommodate this which is why I shop for myself. I did find it a bit annoying that unless I got quickly to breakfast (not always possible with my business appointments) that the newspapers had run out. More tv channels of a more cultural nature would be appreciated, but all in all, these are minor niggles. If you want to be near the heart of Hillcrest, this is a terrific place.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre...to say the least”
Reviews.Author: SacTraveler01
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about this hotel I was expecting a lot more than what we got. I just returned from 3 nights there w/ husband and 2 year old for Memorial Day weekend. The hotel is located on a very busy street and across the parking lot from the emergency room at Scripps Hospital. I requested a quiet room and we were put in a corner on the first floor. We didn't hear other hotel guests but heard sirens at all hours of the day and night. Coupled w/ a loud banging that sounded like a garbage dumpster was being picked up and dropped, I was ready to check out after the 2nd night. Unfortunately due to the busy holiday weekend we didn't have any options and decided to switch rooms. We were moved to the 3rd floor where we didn't hear banging anymore but heard every single footstep the people above us took which sounded like a herd of elephants! The breakfast was terrible. Stale cereal and flavorless waffles. The parking is very tight especially if you have an SUV of any sort. I do have some positives about our experience. Good sized room, fairly comfortable beds and a very nice staff. There are a lot of restaurants in the area. Overall I think this is a standard motel which is trying to be a lot fancier than it really is. Wouldn't stay here again. Next time I would rather spend the money and stay in a nicer hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Benita and staff were the best.”
Reviews.Author: tommymg
Reviews.Content: I booked this room a few months in advance. During this time i had called a few times to make sure everything was in order. I talked to Benita every time, she always made me feel like we were old friends. She was such a pleasure to deal with.When we got there, the front desk staff(including Benita)was great. they offered advise on where to eat places to go ,looked for any offers , even called some places for us.The room was great , maids friendly. overall stay great. I have stayed at many places this is one of the best. I will deffinetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home, only better.”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDogs
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want more room than the average hotel/motel room, comfortable beds/furniture, and good TV selections, as well as a kitchen for the times you just want to stay in and relax. All the comforts of home, plus a pool, plus a tasty breakfast every morning, plus, plus, plus. Wonderful location in the heart of one of the greatest neighborhoods in San Diego. Close to Balboa Park, the S. D. Zoo, fabulous restaurants, wine bars, shops and clubs. If you enjoy parking the car and getting some exercise for part of your stay, all of the above is within walking distance. And there is a long list of things to see and do, such as downtown and the Gaslamp district, the ocean, Sea World, etc. that are within a short car ride from Sommerset Suites. The staff members were always smiling, very pleasant and helpful with whatever was needed. Look forward to staying there again next San Diego visit.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Quiet Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sean6
Reviews.Content: The Front Desk was superb. Extremely helpful and willing to go the extra mile for its customers. The room was old but clean with sufficent towels, and all the amenites. This is an extended stay type of Hotel with Kitchenette. For us the room was large and you felt like you wasn't rubbing elbows with the other traveler. And for us it was quiet. To me that there are two issues. Issue One: Parking is terrible. You better have a small car. Issue Two: Most facilites i.e. washer/dryer is on the fourth floor including the Ice Machine. They need to have one on the first floor, otherwise you are waiting in line to get ice and on a hot day you can see it would run out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: tootsSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect if you're looking to explore the Hillcrest Neighborhood and experience the many great restaurants or have to be in close proximity to hospital facilities. The individual kitchen facilities are adequate for longer staying guests. Public transit is one block away if you wish to visit some of San Diego's other tourist attractions, i.e. Old Town, Sea World, the Zoo. The rooms are clean and the hotel staff are friendly and helpful. We will definitely return to the Sommerset Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartment hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Bruno1234
Reviews.Content: Our extended family spent two nights at the hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had two rooms - a one bedroom suite and a studio suite. The one bedroom suite was very spacious with an excellent separate lounge/dining area and kitchen. There were plenty of pillows and towels as well as bathrobes. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, especially the hot waffles. The staff on the desk were very helpful. The complimentary internet access in the lobby was much appreciated and allowed us to print our boarding passes for our next flight. The location in Hillcrest is excellent and is in easy walking distance to the zoo and Balboa Park. There is a supermarket only a block away to help stock up the kitchen. There are numerous restaurants nearby. We found it easy to catch the bus into the city. Being next to the hospital caused no problem and we didn't notice any extra noise. We also found parking in the hotel garage to be trouble free. If our trip had allowed more time, we would have liked to have stayed longer. This hotel was one of the highlights of our brief trip to the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location while my husband was having surgery at Scripps!”
Reviews.Author: blfox
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how perfect this hotel was for me during my husband's surgery. I found them listed on the Scripps website as possible places to stay. I called and found they had a discounted rate for hospital patients families. They also allowed me to bring my pet so I didn't have to pay addtional boarding costs, just a one time $50.00 fee. I was able to park the car for $6.00 a day, vs $24.00 at the hospital, another savings! I parked my car and walked to the hospital each day after my FREE breakfast. There was a Whole Foods nearby where I was able to shop. After a long day at the hospital, this was so easy as I had my own kitchen to fix something quick. There are many great restaurants nearby if you prefer eating out. Also, they have laundry facilities. Bed was comfortable with lots of different pillows. I also took advantage of the free apples each night at the desk! Everyone here was helpful and nice, from the lady that took care of breakfast, desk clerks, managers, and housekeepers. It was a tough time for me, but I felt very well taken care of at Sommerset Suites. I will return when visiting this area for the zoo and Sea World. They also have a pool and hot tub in a pleasant courtyard area. Only negative is the traffic noise when at the pool area. But that certainly doesn't override all the positives.

Reviews.Title: “I'm so glad we found this place”
Reviews.Author: lbweekender
Reviews.Content: When planning our trip to San Diego for the weekend, we wanted something that has a good location and compfortable. After calling many hotels, we found Sommerset Suites and the staff member we spoke to was very helpful and a genuinely very nice person. Bonita not only treated us like a valued customer, but like a friend. She was very knowledgeable of the area and reserved us the perfect room. Bonita goes above and beyond great customer service (which is rare these days). The room was very comfortable. The pool area looked very inviting, but the weather was not quite warm enough the weekend of our stay to enjoy it. The location was perfect. Walking distance to great restaurants and easy access to the freeway. For anyone who is looking for a hotel in the Hillcrest area, I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: flipxicana
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in this hotel. Only problem i had was with the stove. It didnt work. The matienance guy just left for the day , so got another room which was only a few doors down. The pool might be small for others but for my kids it was perfect! The Breakfast was good..love the waffles...and Martha she was a great help!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ginac6754
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to San Diego. We came with our 4 children (3 of them teenagers). The location was fantastic with easy access to all the local attractions and beaches. The hotel was clean and kept up well with nicely manicured grounds. The beds were surprisinglly quite comfortable and we slept well. There was WiFi and computer access if needed. The complimentary breakfast was good. The kids enjoyed the pool and hotub. We stayed here for a week and the on site laundry facilities came in handy. We really enjoyed the little shops, boutiques and resturants in the neighborhood within walking distance. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our microwave didn't work and they had a new one within minutes to our room. We liked the full size kitchen and it was great for saving money and cooking our own meals. There was also a couple of barbeque grills out by the pool we took advantage of for a couple of meals. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return on another trip in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary_nl
Reviews.Content: It was my third stay in this hotel, and I am still really fond of it. I recommended it to my colleagues who tried it and loved it too. I will come back next time for sure. I like the location, the suites are much enjoyable, the staff really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: allhaildre
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here about 5 times and have nothing but good things to say. The beds are comfortable, the staff are friendly, and the location is great. Great complimentary breakfast as well. Would definitely recommend to anyone traveling to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family's Zoo Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TLCx2
Reviews.Content: First time taking our 20-month twin daughters on a flight to San Diego to enjoy the Zoo. We were so pleased with the room at the Sommerset!! The kitchen was perfect for any travelers - ideal though for those with children. The staff were very friendly, helpful and professional. If I had to say anything on the negative side, the first night we seemed to notice a lot of ambulance sirens - well it is located across from the hospital. Although on the second night stay we hardly noticed them. We will definitely stay there again and look forward to our next trip to beautiful San Diego staying at the Sommerset!!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pmillman
Reviews.Content: The staff is excellent and super friendly, they really care about their guests from check in to departure, great job.

Reviews.Title: “One Of the, If Not the Best Hotel Out There!!!!”
Reviews.Author: donzell9
Reviews.Content: One of if not the best hotel I have stayed at. The rooms are clean and spacious. It is like never leaving your home. The rooms have a little kitchen that you can if you like dine in. But the hotel is just walking distance from all the shops, restautants, and night clubs/bars that you would like to go to. The stuff are so helpful and welcoming, they make sure that your stay is so enjoyable. I stay there everytime I go to San Diego and I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DEHANSEN
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Value ! What else more you can possiblley expect.

Reviews.Title: “very large suites with a wonderful staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: tinypinkhippo
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at sommerset hotel for four nights and were very impressed with the staff. Martha did a great job in the breakfast room and Bonita had some really good advice for the bus and trolley systems. The room we stayed in had a kitchen that even had cookware and dishes supplied. It also has a seperate bedroom away from the living area with a door to seperate which was nice. They also had a computer available in the lobby for people to use which was a nice touch. This hotel is in a great location. There are numerous restaurants, shopping and a theater a block away. Plus it is located on some major bus routes that go everywhere. We had no problem getting around. Each bus will take a $5.00 and give you a day pass that is good on most of the city buses and trolleys for the whole day. My sisters and I even walked home from Balboa Park one evening and had a very pleasant walk with a nice dessert stop along the way. We will be staying here again. This is a wonderful hotel for the price, we were all pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for people with kids”
Reviews.Author: sprinkle101901
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was great, loved the free breakfast, although it was the same every day, it was perfect for our kids and free. The room was priced well, we had a fold out couch, seperate room, and playpen, the kitchen and table was really nice too with our kids, we could refridgerate leftovers. Really close to zoo, seaworld and beaches. Parking was difficult with a big car, but they do have a parking garage. Staff was really nice! I didnt like the bathroom inside the bedroom, would have liked it off the main room, but oh well!! The pool was basic, but not deep, our 7 year old loved it, as well as the hot tub looking over the road. Kept up well even though its an older hotel. I wished they had dvd players in the rooms though. Overall it was wonderfull, and easy to find from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, practical, and economical for family or business trips”
Reviews.Author: uclady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a place that had a separate space for my "senior" mom, and the Somerset Suites fit the bill perfectly. Our "room" was actually a one-bedroom apartment with a very comfortable sleeper sofa for mom, a private bedroom for my husband and me, and a practical kitchenette that included a complimentary basket of snacks and bottled water as well as lovely robes and toiletries (the kind of things you pay extra for in a lot of hotels). Everything was spotlessly clean although the decor is a bit worn. Breakfast in the mornings was included and was more than the usual continental fare, with made to order waffles and a very cheerful and friendly staff. I didn't use the pool, but it looked adequate and even had barbecues that would be a great feature for families visiting in the summer. The location is great--right in the middle of Hillcrest, which offers a myriad of dining choices--and close to all of San Diego's many attractions. Some reviewers here have complained that the parking lot is cramped; they're right, but I had more trouble with other guests parking their SUVs across two spaces than with the spaces themselves being particularly narrow. Others here have complained about the noise: be advised, the hotel is next to a hospital, so there is the occasional ambulance going by, and is on a main street in a business district. These things did not bother us, but are good to note. The only other caveat I would note is that we booked our stay only 24 hours in advance and on the hotel's website. When we got there, reception did not have a record of our reservation and the agent at the desk said it must not have come through yet. While there was no problem getting a room, I would recommend making your reservation online and calling to confirm if you are reserving on short notice. We frequently visit San Diego for short one- or two-night stays, and will definitely stay at the Somerset Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HBBear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great vibrant gay neighborhood of San Diego. Within walking distance to many local restaurants and ease of access to freeways to get you anywhere in San Diego in a very short time. The hotel is kind of older but kept up. Many of the hallways are open air but security is pretty good so no need to worry. Nice pool area and breakfast area for a quick bight on the run. The main objection with this hotel is the parking situation. Parking is on the street level of the building but the slots are so small that they barely fit a compact car. And yet, they charge $5 per day. It isn't much, but the headaches you get for parking the fee should be free. They do have an ajoining lot available that they share with a medical clinic after hours which helps but you have to park about a half a block away from the enterence of the hotel. It doesn't seem far but when you are hauling suitcases and other bags, it isn't at all convenient. All in all, we have stayed here several times just due to it being the nicest of any of the other hotels in the area. Again, more of a neighborhood feel to the area and not touristy which gives you a nice flavor of one of the best cities in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Ecorep1
Reviews.Content: My wife and 3 yo son spent three nights, and enjoyed it very much. Full kitchen, large rooms and not far from Balboa Park and Convention Center. Not the ideal location for taking a walk, but grocery stores and few restaurants not far. Down side was terrible shower head and control of hot and cold water, very small size toilet seat, and thin walls. We could hear our neighbors beside us and above, but there was little late night activity. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: LKM0m
Reviews.Content: Not perfect but great for families. Clean. Comfortable beds. Recently redone, but some of the quality is questionable...not sure how long it will stay looking nice. Pool perfect for kids...only 3 ft deep. Continental breakfast average. Convenient to the zoo and Sea World. Walking distance to a street with many restaurants. Next to a hospital so ambulance noise could be an issue...we didn't hear any at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre rooms”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTravelerz
Reviews.Content: We picked the Sommerset Suites because of its location, and that did not disappoint. It's very convenient to SeaWorld, Balboa Park, and the airport (it took us about 10 minutes to get to the airport early in the morning on the way out). Parking was fairly easy despite the fact that we had a minivan. It's clear that this place used to be an apartment building. The 1 bedroom "suite" we had reminded me of the cruddy apartment I had in college. It was serviceable but not at all nice. Mold on the walls, bedroom door would not shut all the way. On the plus side it had a fully kitted out kitchen with utensils, etc. We had a nice balcony that overlooked the hospital next door, which provided a little show one evening for the kids as a medevac helicopter landed and later took off from the roof of the emergency room next door. Luckily it wasn't in the middle of the night. The service was way above what you'd expect in a place like this. The front desk staff was very cheerful, the continental breakfast room staff was also friendly, but the real test was when our daughter had an accident in the bathtub during a bath and when we phoned to get cleaner to clean it up, we got a very quick response (although no offer to clean it up themselves which I wouldn't have expected :). There are quite a few nice restaurants within walking distance in the Hillcrest area, just a few blocks away. I have to advise giving the "City Deli" a miss as I got horrible food poisoning probably from there (and the food was pretty mediocre too). In retrospect we should have gone to the Corvette Diner as I had originally planned. The kids enjoyed the pool which got a little chilly due to the shade in the afternoon (it's in a courtyard in the middle of the building), and it was a little smelly too. If you are looking for a 1 bedroom place near the zoo and Seaworld, the Sommerset Suites will fit the bill. Just don't expect the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value”
Reviews.Author: JimyDavid
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in San Diego Friday till Tuesday. Hotel is in a convenient location, in Hillcrest neighborhood. Parking available for 5 dollars a day . Rooms large with kitchen, but many great restaurants nearby. Staff friendly and helpful. Great pool and hot tub. Breakfast OK, with enough options to satisfy. Good value overall. We had a rental car but took the bus downtown because it was more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ma65
Reviews.Content: I loved this little hotel. It is easy to find, easy to park, in a nice area, and perfect for families. We had a one bedroom suite, with a queen sofa sleeper in the living room. The breakfast offered was nothing to write home about, but was better that the average "continental breakfast". There is a Whole Foods not too far away, and the kitchen allows you to make your own breakfast (or dinner, for that matter). The so called "pool" is more like a big tub, perhaps 20 by 12 feet, but it's clean and nice to relax in after a long day at the zoo or Sea World. There is also a spa. I could use the computer in the lobby free of charge to check my e-mails, and do a "mid-trip" laundry in the coin operated laundry in the top floor. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location, Some inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: toddinparis
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, especially for Scripps Hospital (next door). Neighborhood is lively and gay, lots of restaurants & shops. Hotel staff was nice & fun, but professional. We checked into our room, but the maid was still cleaning it, so they switched us. The non-smoking room smelled of smoke. The internet didn't work, and we spent a lot of time (with no compensation) on the phone with tech support or calling the front desk. What a pain! But the rooms are nice, clean, functional -- and the breakfast was good. Overall, I'd recommend it and will probably go back. Try to get a room overlooking the pool, as other rooms have boring views.

Reviews.Title: “OKAY stay”
Reviews.Author: freakyholiday
Reviews.Content: For a discounted rate the place was fine. The only negatives were the noise issues...Very thin walls...Can hear everything going on in adjoining rooms & in the hall...Housekeeping very noisy early in the AM...Loud persistant conversations in Spanish heard all morning...The old box AC/Heater unit on the wall was very loud and worked poorly...The $5 daily parking fee for the always tight self park lot is a joke...They never charged before... Most "motels" in this style/category offer free self parking for a paid guest!

Reviews.Title: “Great value nice area”
Reviews.Author: Major_Delays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sommerset Suites for 2 nights and on the whole it proved to be good choice. We had a rate of £69 through Expedia and we felt that for the size of the room this was extremely good value. The hotel is located on a main road (Washington Street, at intersection with 8th Avenue), so you need to take care if you have small children, but otherwise found that traffic noise didn't really affect us. It is located in an area of San Diego called Hillcrest which we found to be very nice and the hotel is a short walk (less than 200 yards) from a good selection of restaurants, convenience stores and fuel. More generally it is only a couple of miles from the hotel into San Diego downtown area and also a couple of miles to the Zoo, so location is great. On the whole the decor in the hotel is a little tired, not tatty but it's getting to the point where it needs updating. The staff were pleasant and helpful. They have an outside pool and hottub located in the central courtyard of the property. I'd recommend this hotel to singles, couples or families if they are traveling on a reasonable budget.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our week at the Sommerset in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: minerniner
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Hillcrest neighborhood at the Sommerset Suites. It was perfect for our family of four (with two girls ages 3 and 5). The separate bedroom let mom and dad stay up without worrying about waking the kids. We stayed 7 nights and couldn't have been happier with the special week long rate provided through their web site. There were so many restaurants and coffee houses to walk to (you have to go to Peet's Coffee, Corvette Diner, City Delicatessen, and Hash House A Go Go). The only issue was with the free breakfast, while it was good, there was not enough seating and it got crowded so we ended up skipping it. Once the weather warms up a little more, you could sit outside by the pool which would give a little more room. Anyhow, the money we saved more than payed for breakfast out and it let us see more of the Neighborhood and surrounding area (for breakfast try City Delicatessen, Hob Nob Hill, Adams Steak and Eggs, or any of Hillcrest's neighborhood coffee houses).

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: tjmm13
Reviews.Content: Traveling with two teens and needed three beds. This hotel met our needs for a great price. Clean and friendly. The free breakfast and $5 for parking allowed us to spend $100 to $200 a day more on activities. Marta "the waffle lady" at breakfast was terrific. Location was minutes from everywhere by car, and also a block away from Corvette Diner and movie theater. Nice neighborhood. Next to hospital, but only found Saturday night to be a bit noisy. The rest of the week was quiet. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with kids....”
Reviews.Author: akameme
Reviews.Content: Don't let the exterior fool you...the place is pretty nice inside (carpets and furniture are pretty updated)...even granite counters in the kitchen. The location is awesome...one block from tons of restaurants and even a Whole Foods (which is great because you have a full kitchen) and there is a Ralph's a little farther down. The breakfast was good...staff is nice and friendly. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. We have 15 month old twins.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: rjbarr4
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel for a week with my 10 year old daughter. Hotel exceeded my expectations. Good breakfast, free parking, pool and hot tub clean, location is great for travelling to Zoo, Seaworld, etc. lots of trendy restaurants nearby and grocery stores are about six blocks away. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in cute neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. My studio room had a kitchenette with everything you needed to cook. Almost an apartment. The property is handy to the Hillcrest neighborhood (steps from Peets Coffee, 2 drug stores, a Trader Joes and Whole Foods, plus many interesting local restaurants. Staff was friendly. Room was spotless. Rate was a steal. Book directly with the hotel website for the best rates. What can I say? If you like "staying in a neighborhood", you might like the Somerset Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Was good, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: PHXTrainer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after the fires, every room in SD was booked as well as my favorite the Park Manor. I prefer to stay close to hillcrest so this was my other option. The room was large and the kitchen was great to have. I booked a king but as usual since I check in late was given two doubles. The front desk adjusted my bill and I was thankful. The front room was nice to have and the bedroom was decent size. The internet was spotty and it took a long time to download my email but it worked. The beds were so-so and the pillows were the same. This place has a much better location than the Park and it is less expensive. I booked again for next month even though I prefer the park, end of year budget crunch...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ideally located in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: WoodlandsSingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 days in June. There was a discount for a 4 day stay. The 1 bedroom suite we were in is quite spacious, and there was a sofa bed in the living room too. It housed my family of 4 comfortably. My wife was very happy with the kitchen, which is adequately stocked. There was a stove with 4 hot-plates, a microwave oven, a refigerator, dishwasher, an oven and utensils of all sorts. Our room was serviced everyday, the rubbish in the kitchen was cleared, our towel changed and our bed made everyday. Well done, the housekeeping staff of the hotel. One improvement that I would like to suggest to the hotel is to change the shelf by the doorway. Apparently, it was a shelf once upon a time, but the door have now been removed, and the several levels of wooden planks now hang loosely on the wall. I only dare to put light things on it. Perhaps it is time to either remove it or install a new shelf. The bathroom has a bathtub, and bath robes were provided. There is pay TV and TV Games in the living room. My son had a good time indulging himself in the games, which comes up to about US$60. Anyway, it is not often that he has such opportunities. Breakfast was provided in the breakfast room, which is beside the pool. This was the highlight of our stay here. The staff in the breakfast room were prompt in replenishing the food, courteous in their interaction with the hotel guests, and very accomodating. There is a variety of food, including the favourite of most guests, self-made waffle. There is also a restroom and TV in the room. The front desk was prompt in checking us in and out, but unfortunately the hotel shuttle was down when we need it to go to the airport. We took a taxi instead, which doesn't cost too much. The hotel is also quite near to the train station. We took a train from Anaheim to San Diego, the costal scenery along the way was great. There were plenty of taxi outside the station. We took a taxi too from the zoo back to the hotel, which cost less than $10. There are also buses passing nearby the hotel. We took bus 10 from the bus stop near the hotel to the old town interchange, and change to bus 9 to go to the Sea World. There is a Vons supermarket less than 1 mile away from the hotel, and also a cheap Chinese restaurant, Panda Express, less than half a mile from the hotel. The hotel is really ideally located for us to explore around the area, as well as to get to the attractions in san Diego. Overall, I am comfortable to recommend this hotel to families that are looking for a quiet place, that is convenient to get around SanDiego.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: AZMOMMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 2 kids, ages 3 and 1, for four nites. My husband at a conference at the convention center which was a quick drive for him each morning--10 minutes--from this hotel, which by the way offers free parking. The hotel location is a bit of a mix--surrounded by a hospital and various health care buildings on one side and just a block from bustling Hillcrest. We weren't bothered much by the intermittent emergency vehicle noise. Running the fan on the AC unit drowned out any noise. Beds comfy, bathroom roomy, nice shower/bath. The room itself is very roomy; had a one bedroom suite with 2 doubles. More than enough storage, shelving. Two TVs with cable. Well stocked kitchen, but could have been a bit more user-friendly had we been supplied with dish soap or dishwasher liquid to clean up. Continental breakfast plentiful, but could offer more choices in yogurt and fresh fruit. Wonderful woman named Martha runs the show and all but puts the napkin on your lap---so helpful, friendly and my kids loved her sweet disposition. Great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 50+traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room with Expedia.com.au, our price was $120 a night for September 2007. ( Two people, Two Beds. ) The Hotel was great, when we booked in the airline we`d flown to San Diego on had lost our bags and the girl at reception immediately offered us toothpaste and brushes. Rooms are spotlessly clean, there is a stove, microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. Our room had a balcony that overlooked the pool. Another reviewer has said that because it is near a hospital the ambulances kept her awake. I never heard an ambulance and the rooms are very soundproof. Positon suited me down to the ground, walk out the front door turn right, cross at the first set of traffic lights and the next street down is University. Restaurants everywhere, good neighbourhood. Regular buses down town that take about 10 minutes. Other people have critised the continental breakfast, it was enough for me ,fresh waffles, toast, yoghurt, coffee, juice. This property had a Two and a half star rating on Expedia I would give it Four. For Smokers this property from the 1st September is now non smoking but management allowed us to smoke on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - nice clean room”
Reviews.Author: Micknyny
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose Sommerset Suites Hotel since the Park Manor Hotel (usually preference) was completely booked. We prefer staying in Hillcrest with its wide selection of restaurants and gay night life (all walking distance). The hotel was a pleasant surprise: clean, roomy, quiet and a good value; the unit had a balcony albeit the view was the back of a hospital. We especially liked the full kitchen with full frig, stove and oven. The continental breakfast was definitely above average: guests can make their waffles. We were a bit worried about our room's close distance to Mercy Hospital's ER, however, ambulance noise was never an issue. Although not needed, we did have an air conditioning unit in the event noise or heat were an issue (many San Diego hotels don't have air conditioning -- since at night, it is usually not needed). Overall, a good value. Also liked the fact that parking was free too. Although we were a couple, families would like this place.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed here for 33 days..........”
Reviews.Author: defjam279
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 33 days during a business trip to San Diego and found it to be a comfortable and enjoyable stay. The location. The hotel is located in the Hill Crest area of San Diego. There are a lot of shops and restaurants in the area and it is only 1 mile or so from the Gas Lamp district. There is a bus stop close by so you can take the bus to the Gas Lamp district with ease. Hill Crest is known as the "gay area" of San Diego and the reason is obvious during the evenings. If this fact somehow bothers you, be advised. Finally, the hotel is located right next to a major hospital. Throughout the day you will hear ambulances racing to the hospital. In my opinion, it was not that big of a deal, but I did hear a few guests complain about the noise. I would suggest asking for a room away from the hospital. The hotel. I would not call the hotel modern; its years are starting to show. However, it was adequately furnished and clean. I was here for a long period and it was nice that the room had a kitchen and all the necessary dishes, pots, glasses, etc. There was a breakfast every morning in the continental style. It wasn't massive, but it was good. Finally, the parking was free, abundant, and convenient. In short, this is a good place to stay if you are trying to manage a central location with a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: lovetowinbingo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. This is an older hotel in the quaint, safe, uptown area of San Diego called Hillcrest. It is located directly across the street from a hospital but we only heard ambulances 3 times during our stay and never at night. We stayed on the 2nd floor and only heard walking from above twice in the bathroom. We had a one bedroom suite which had 2 queen beds in the bedroom and a queen pullout sofa in the livingroom. We fit 3 adults and 3 children comfortably. There was a full kitchen with pots, dishes and utensils, a coffee maker and microwave. There was plenty of closet space and hangers to my surprise. There was a balcony off the livingroom that did have a safety bar lock for the children but the bedroom window did not have any lock or screen so if the kids opened it, out they could go. So my husband wedged something between the wall and the window for their safety. There is a laundry room on the 4th floor wich was convenient but you must bring detergent with you or you can buy it at the front desk for $1. There is no change machine in the laundry room so bring that too. The washer is $1 and the dryer is 75 cents. There is a nice pool area with a hot tub, both were very clean and the hot tub nice and hot. Even though it is an older hotel, everything was kept very clean. From the room to the grounds I was very pleased with the cleanliness. There is a complimentary breakfast that was a great start for a busy day. It included bagels, english muffins, toast, 3 types of cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, make your own waffles (great for the kids), apple, orange, and cranberry juice, muffins, coffee, tea and milk. This was a great breakfast with plenty to choose from and something for everyone. Martha was one of the breakfast hosts and she was the BEST!!. She was friendly, helpful with the kids making their waffles and making sure we had everything we needed. She was happy and smiling and we looked forward to seeing her at breakfast each morning. Our last day there Martha was off and breakfast just wasn't the same. We would go back just to see Martha. On our first night at the hotel I noticed the air conditioning unit was leaking water so at midnight I called the front desk and let them know we needed this fixed. The next day when we came home from Legoland, there was a new, updated digital unit installed and in perfect working condition. I also called housekeeping the next night to let them know we needed more shampoo and soap and coffee creamer because we had 6 people in our suite and the next day and every day after there was plenty of everything. I was very pleased with the response I received when I needed something from the hotel, this showed great customer service. This hotel is 30 min. to Legoland, 10 minutes to Sea World and 5 minutes to Balboa Park. They did give us directions at the front desk which was helpful. No matter what time of day we got back to the hotel there was always parking and spots close to the door. We never had a problem parking and the hotel was sold out when we were there. I was a little nervous reading the negative reviews about the parking and ambulance noise and bugs but I did not find any of this to be true. We had a great stay at this hotel for a great price (200/night). This hotel worked out perfect for our San Diego trip.

Reviews.Title: “Negative reviews not true for us! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: USTravelerNewYork
Reviews.Content: We were worried about staying here after reading the recent negative reviews, but were pleasantly surprised and had a lovely stay at this clean hotel in a great location. We booked a handicapped accessible room thru Expedia and called the hotel the night before to confirm. They explained the rooms availalbe thru Expedia were not accessible, but after a few minutes of holding we were upgraded to a king accessible suite. It's nothing fancy, but was clean and roomy and the kitchen really came in handy: full fridge, stove, microwave, coffeemaker, utensils, dishes, some pots and pans. There was no noise from the hospital that we heard. The free breakfast was adequate: cereal, toast, bagels, waffles, juice, coffee. The pool is quite small and only 3 feet deep but there were children there having lots of fun. One of the best features is the location. Leave the car behind and simply cross the street to eat at the great local restaurants: Japanese, Indian, Italian, Diner, Afghan, Lebanese, etc. etc. Hillcrest is a great area that's close to downtown and everything else. Highly recommend Sommerset Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not recommended”
Reviews.Author: VivaVacations
Reviews.Content: Horrible, just horrible, I don't know where to begin: - plumbing in my bathroom was never fixed. The shower ran from hot to scalding. And it would randomly fluctuate during your shower from those two temperatures. I have an infant daughter and was deathly afraid of giving her 3rd degree burns during her bath. - Breakfast was OK as long as you showed up before 8 AM. After that it's pretty slim pickings as the food does NOT get replenished. The lady who looks after it from Mon to Thurs is very nice but the other two who do the weekend shift spent most of their time hiding from guests. - the hot tub was out-of-order during the entire week I was there. The pool had a LOT of sand in the bottom of it. Neither were fixed nor cleaned. - anytime you asked the front counter staff for anything (shuttle bus, detergent for the 4th floor laundromat) they didn't know the answer, the bus just left, we just ran out of soap, the plumber just fixed it, etc... It was like listening to people describing UFO sightings. - front counter staff did NOT know the neighbourhood at all. When we asked him where the closest grocer was he had us walk 20 min down to the bad part of Washington Ave. How bad? I was in line between a drug addict and a drunk. We found a grocery store later that day just 4 blocks away. In my case this was one of the last hotels available (I was going to the ESRI conference June 2007) and I will never allow myself nor any of my coworkers to stay here at future conferences. San Diego is a beautiful place to visit. Just don't stay at the Sommerset Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Has roaches and smells like animal feces and urine”
Reviews.Author: ta761
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay here if you do not love animals and their smells and do not like roaches. I stayed here with a group of five people and had read the mixed reviews, but booked the hotel because the average review rating was pretty good. The first hotel room we checked into had a horrible smell so we asked to switch rooms. The second room we checked into smelled alot fresher and was alot cleaner than the first so we were happy with that room at first. That is until we went out to dinner and came back to find the kitchen filled with roaches!! We were out of there and went to stay at Comfort suites on hotel circle which was a much better hotel(very clean and no roaches, smoking or animal smells.)

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: vanessan12
Reviews.Content: I spent my Memorial Weekend with my family in San Diego and stayed at Somerset Hotel. The total experience was terrible. I booked for a 2 double beds suite but was given a single king size bedroom. I was not notified of the change at the time of check-in.
