When I questioned the front desk clerk, I was told that's all they have left and the 2 double beds are not available. I had 4 adults and 2 children sleeping in a SINGLE room. I expressed to the clerk of how unhappy I am with the situation, he told me that I was lucky to even get a room. For compensation, we were given 2 very uncomfortable roll-away beds to sleep in. The room was smelly and difficult to settle in. I asked to speak to the manager but there were no manager or supervisor around to address my concerns. No one called back either. I had to directly go to the front desk and look for the manager myself. Parking was also horrible, the space are tiny that is if you could find a space. I had to park 2 blocks away and walked back to the hotel. If you hope to get a good night sleep, don't count on getting any restful night there. The hotel is located next to a medical building, so siren of ambulances were heard throughout the nights. Do yourself a favor and DON'T book your reservation here. Please!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sommerset Suites good value for the money and location”
Reviews.Author: Lunit
Reviews.Content: Booked a king suite with separate bedroom for two nights at $119 per night. Suite was a good size and clean. Bed was comfortable with ample linens. Desk clerk brought fresh bathrobes within minutes of request. Breakfast was fine, the freshly made waffles were an unexpected extra. Location was excellent for walking to dining. The only down side was the noise from the room above. Someone was thumping loudly on the floor until very late at night, 2 AM. Called the desk but nothing happened. I agree with other reviews that the carpets are in need of cleaning or replacing as they are stained. Overall experience was positive and would recommend this hotel for anyone interested in an inexpensive stay with plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: FraserRambler
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and we stayed for seven nights at Sommerset Suites Hotel. We all liked the hotel and would stay there again. It had its good and bad points: PRO Central location to everything Friendly staff Nice breakfast selection every morning Spacious rooms with full kitchen, bedding for five, and two television sets Balcony with decent view (great if like hospitals) Attentive housekeeping Walking distance to many Hillcrest restaurants Relatively quiet despite the occasional ambulance siren CON Parking spaces too narrow A little outdated, but not as bad as people are writing. It could use some fresh paint but overall, it's more than acceptable Overall, a solid choice for vacationing. It's nothing spectacular, but it's budget-friendly and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, So-So Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: farmview
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sommerset Suites three nights with three young children (ages 6 and 4) for one night and then two consecutive nights a few days later. The hotel is conveniently located between the "5" and the "163," which made traveling from the hotel very easy. The hotel also has free parking. The spaces are small; however, there were plenty of spaces even though the hotel was completely booked. Our first suite (Room 306) was far better than our second, so rooms vary. The decor is dated and literally nothing matched in our first suite (drapes, wallpaper, bedding, etc.) but the room was very clean. We had a balcony overlooking the pool and did not have a problem with noise from the neighboring medical center. The second suite we had was not very good (Room 212). Although the room was "clean," the carpet was stained and I suspect that an animal had been staying there previously since it had a funky smell (the hotel allows animals for an extra $35 a night). Normally I would ask to switch rooms but our three children were practically asleep by the time we checked in and we were not going to spend much time there. I wore flip flops to be on the safe side. The hotel offers a complimentary continental breakfast consisting of waffles, toast, bagels, cereal, pastries, fruit, juice, milk, and coffee. It also offers salami and cheese, which I didn't quite understand; however, my children loved the salami. I'm not sure if I would stay at the Sommerset again. If this review was based on our our first suite I would definately stay again, but I wouldn't based on the second suite. Relative to location, price and size, it is a great deal. If I stay here again, I would definately make sure that I had a chance to check out the suite and ask to be relocated if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “offers alot at reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: montemarg
Reviews.Content: The sommerset suites are very reasonable in price. The rooms are dated and can use updating, however are clean. The biggest advantage is free tickets to the San Diego Zoo, (check out other offers too), free breakfast, free afternoon snacks (popcorn, nachos to name a few), wine and cheese. There is a pool and hot tub and a great location to access local San Diego sites. If you are planning to spend minimal time in your room and enjoy San Diego- this is a great place to stay. If you are looking for a pampered, luxurious surrounding look elsewhere. Good for families. Do Not Miss "HASH HOUSE A GO GO" for dinner, one plate is definitely enough for 2 or more, YUM!!!!!!!!!!! The Prado is another great place to dine!

Reviews.Title: “Would not return to Sommerset Suites”
Reviews.Author: jsnco
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms with a San Diego Zoo package (two nights and zoo tickets) along with an extra night. Unfortunately we ended up staying just one night as we were so disappointed in the Sommerset Suites. One of the two rooms we were given was a "smoking optional" room. As a non-smoker, the smell in the room was horrid and when I checked at the front desk, I was told there were no more rooms available and I could not change. Although the rooms were spacious and all the staff I dealt with were so friendly and helpful ... the furniture, carpeting and bedding did not seem very clean and I did not feel comfortable in the rooms. The carpeting and paint in the central hallways was dirty with stains on the carpets and lots of marks on the walls. The spaces in the parking garage were tiny and it was very difficult parking even our small rental car (subaru wagon). Quite disappointing for our much anticipated holiday in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaKennyBoy
Reviews.Content: After a great 3 nights at the Embassy Suites in LA, we were rather disappointed with how outdated and in need of refurbishing this hotel was. Our first room wasn't all that clean on checking in, so we asked for another suite. The staff were accommodating, but the second suite, although cleaner, had the surface of the shower stall flaking off and some mould. The most disappointing aspect though was the fold-out sofa bed. Very hard to sleep when you have metal rails or whatever sticking into your back all night long. We cut our stay short at this hotel, and wouldn't go back there. The one positive was ample parking.

HotelInfo.Name: Sommerset Suites Hotel
